skillTree.name: Oath of Forging
skillTree.description: To fire the forges and bring true craft and artifice back into the world.

effects.description:
Oathgold from buildings: +50%
	(local province)

skillTree.name: Obdurate
skillTree.description: All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.

effects.description: Leadership: +9

skillTree.name: Lord of the Deeps
skillTree.description: A true Lord knows the Underway, his Dwarfhold and how to fight under the ground better than anyone.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Obstinacy
skillTree.description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Brass-Lunged
skillTree.description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%

skillTree.name: Rune of Grimnir
skillTree.description: The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawiâ€™s own reserves.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Gyrocopter
skillTree.description: Gyrocopters are revolutionary flying machines that provides the armies of the Dwarfs with dedicated aerial support or as a form of fast reconnaissance.

effects.description: Mount: "Gyrocopter"

skillTree.name: Fast Reconnaissance Unit
skillTree.description: Gyrocopters are as valuable for reconnaissance as they are for combat, sensing the most advantageous positions from which Grimm and his army can inflict the most harm.

effects.description: Attribute: Vanguard Deployment (when piloting a Gyrocopter)
Speed: +12% (when piloting a Gyrocopter)

skillTree.name: Scanning Device
skillTree.description: This new scanning device reveals enemy troop movement with greater efficiency.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +25%

Ambush defence chance: +20%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Trollhammer Upgrade
skillTree.description: This modified cannon fires Trollhammer Torpedoes - a spiky cone of death - at unfortunate foes.

effects.description:
"Trollhammer Torpedo" ammunition (when piloting a Gyrocopter)
	Projectiles cause anti-large damage

skillTree.name: Gyrobomber
skillTree.description: A Gyrobomber is a heavily-modified version of the Gyrocopter, equipped with a large payload of powerful bombs and ordinance.

effects.description: Mount: "Gyrobomber"

skillTree.name: Gromril Plating
skillTree.description: This new armoured gyrobomber plating has been developed to withstand high temperatures, as well as enemy strikes.

effects.description: Armour: +20 (when piloting a Gyrobomber)
Missile resistance: 15% (when piloting a Gyrobomber)
Speed: -5% (when piloting a Gyrobomber)

skillTree.name: Napalm Bombs
skillTree.description: Enemies struck by these bombs have their flesh melted off them in a slough, leaving only scorched bones and a foul-smelling liquid that is best described as 'goo'. Even the bravest of those who survive, after seeing their comrades so gruesomely reduced, have been known to flee immediately.

effects.description:
Ability: "Napalm Bomb" (when piloting a Gyrobomber)
	(replaces: "Skyhammer Bomb")

skillTree.name: Flamethower Upgrade
skillTree.description: This flamethower is a a powerful and deadly technological weapon that showers enemy units with a wave of white-hot alchemic fire.

effects.description:
"Flaming Shot" ammunition (when piloting a Gyrobomber)
	Projectiles cause fire damage

skillTree.name: The Young Engineer
skillTree.description: Grimm Burloksson is the youngest Dwarf to pass the many rituals required to be named a Master Engineer.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Ballistics Calibration"
Cooldown: -30% for "Restock!"
Ability number of uses: +2 for "Restock!"

skillTree.name: Son of a Guildmaster
skillTree.description: As the son of the Guildmaster Burlok Damminsson, it was always expected that he would follow in his fatherâ€™s footsteps. Even the eldest guildmembers conceded his ability; however, there were signs that his judgement was suspect and he did not value the ancient laws that Dwarf Engineers are expected to follow.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Master Engineers

Hero recruit rank: +5 for Master Engineers
	(local province)

skillTree.name: Skilled Inventor
skillTree.description: Even as a beardling, Grimm exhibited all the signs of a skilled inventor; when other aspirants were still learning basic principles, he had already constructed a self-lighting pipe, a steam-powered beard-braider and a double-barrelled rifle that could kill a half-dozen Greenskins with one shot.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -20% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -20% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.name: Like Father, Like Son
skillTree.description: Unheeding of advice, Grimm continues to forego the precision tuning so beloved by his guild and instead focuses on the trial and error of his own bold inventions.

effects.description:
Recruitment duration: -1 for Irondrakes, Flame Cannon, Gyrocopters and Gyrobombers units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +2 for Irondrakes, Flame Cannon, Gyrocopters and Gyrobombers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Engineering Genius
skillTree.description: An eccentric, if somewhat erratic genius, the young Engineer torments his guildmates by attempting new designs, questioning past methods and stubbornly refusing to give up new inventions.

effects.description:
Hero action cost: -30% for Master Engineers
	(all characters)

skillTree.name: Rocket Engineering
skillTree.description: Rocket Engineering was something Grimm's father started experimenting on years ago, it only makes sense his son would continue the family tradition.

effects.description: Army ability: "Grudgebuster Rocket"

skillTree.name: Standardised Firing Drill
skillTree.description: A Master Engineer knows all about firing rates, fields of fire and the best ratios, his knowledge improving efficiency.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10%

skillTree.name: Augmented Weapon
skillTree.description: Dwarf Engineers are known throughout the world as unparalleled masters of science, gadgets, and technology.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5
Weapon strength: +5%
Melee attack: +10
Weapon strength: +10%

skillTree.name: Technical Enhancements
skillTree.description: Engineers always tinker, naming these tweaks "enhancements" - most do improve whatever contraption they are working on.

effects.description: Armour: +7
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10
Armour: +15
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +20

skillTree.name: Triangulation
skillTree.description: Engineers use number-lore to work out the best trajectories and prime killing arcs for their war machines.

effects.description: Missile strength: +7%
Missile strength: +15%

skillTree.name: Dead Eye
skillTree.description: A dead eye shot is an Engineer or Thunderer that can hit a target at over five hundred (Dwarfen) paces.

effects.description: Range: +8%
Range: +15%
Ability: "Ballistics Calibration"

skillTree.name: Overseer
skillTree.description: Those Engineers that spend their lives underground have a good understanding of war in the caverns.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%

Reload time reduction: +4%
	(Lord's army)
Leadership aura size: +50%

Reload time reduction: +8%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Weapons Engineer
skillTree.description: If you could once kill with it, this one can make it kill again, more and better.

effects.description: Range: +5%
Armour-piercing missile damage: +20%
Range: +10%
Armour-piercing missile damage: +40%

skillTree.name: Ballistics Instructor
skillTree.description: Those Engineers conversant in ballistics know how best to increase the ranges of their weapons.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Ballistics Instructor"
Passive ability: "Extra Powder"

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.name: Axe Lord
skillTree.description: A Lord and his az are never separated, for it is as much part of him as his beard.

skillTree.name: Tactician
skillTree.description: Dwarfs are long-lived with many years of battlefield experience, making them excellent tacticians.

skillTree.name: Tradition & Innovation
skillTree.description: The Dawi continually push the boundaries of engineering, be it by soaring ever higher in their flying contraptions or firing projectiles farther than ever before.

skillTree.name: Fire & Fury
skillTree.description: Only Dwarfen forges burn hotter than those unfortunates caught in the blaze of Dawi ingenuity.

skillTree.name: Grimnir's Heirs
skillTree.description: Full of grim determination, when Dwarfs join battle there is no retreat, only victory or death.

skillTree.name: Thunderer
skillTree.description: This Lord knows his throng thrives in ranged combat and expects his Clansdwarfs to excel in that discipline.

skillTree.description: Those who pass the trials of the Ancestor God have proven their honour without question.

skillTree.description: None know the strength of the Dawi better than those who've suffered their firepower firsthand.

skillTree.name: Honoured by Grimnir
skillTree.description: All Dwarfs worship Grimnir, but only a select few warriors receive his personal recognition.

skillTree.name: Morgrimâ€™s Favoured
skillTree.description: Morgrim's favour is not handed out on a whim; this god blesses only the truest disciples of Dawi engineering.

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.description: Master Engineers familiar with defensive formations use their centuries of experience in sieges.

skillTree.name: Wall Breaker
skillTree.description: "I have seen better lavatory walls than this - I'll have it down by the morrow, that's a pledge!"

factionEffects.title: Brotherhood of the Anvil
factionEffects.description: Zhufbar is the centre of metalwork for the Karaz Ankor and also contains the principal shrine of the Dwarf Engineer's Guild. Although it is surrounded by greenskin tribes, and its lowermost levels are riddled with Skaven, Zhufbar stands strong.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +2 for Master Engineers
Hero recruitment cost: -50% for Master Engineers
Research rate: +20%
Construction cost: -50% for all Engineering chain buildings
